content: I am a second-year Computer Science PhD student at Boston University, lucky to be advised by Derry Wijaya. Before that I received my masters in Statistics from Carnegie Mellon University. I earned my bachelors both in Industrial and Computer Engineering from Koç University, Istanbul. I am currently interested in natural language processing, computer vision and learning with less labels along with some applications to journalism and communications.
summary: I am a second-year Computer Science PhD student at Boston University, lucky to be advised by Derry Wijaya. Before that I received my masters in Statistics from Carnegie Mellon University. I earned my bachelors both in Industrial and Computer Engineering from Koç University, Istanbul.
title: Afra Feyza Akyürek

summary: News framing refers to the strategy in which aspects of certain issues are highlighted in the news to promote a particular interpretation. This paper provides an efficient method to automatically determine multiple frames in a given news headline across multiple languages using only basic resources.
title: Multi-label and Multilingual News Framing Analysis
